Massachusetts Probate and Family Court s.raw_text: Massachusetts Probate and Family Court statutes and rules governing custody, modification of custody, and visitation
Massachusetts Probate and Family Court s.proposition: This Court has jurisdiction over the subject matter and the parties pursuant to the Massachusetts Probate and Family Court statutes and rules governing custody, modification of custody, and visitation, because the parties and the child reside in Bristol County and because this action seeks modification of an existing custody order entered by this Court on April 15, 2019.

- Massachusetts General Laws, chapters a.raw_text: - Massachusetts General Laws, chapters and provisions governing custody, guardianship and Probate & Family Court jurisdiction (Mass. Gen. Laws chs. governing family law and custody).
- Massachusetts General Laws, chapters a.proposition: - Massachusetts General Laws, chapters and provisions governing custody, guardianship and Probate & Family Court jurisdiction (Mass. Gen. Laws chs. governing family law and custody).

- Massachusetts Probate & Family Court r.raw_text: - Massachusetts Probate & Family Court rules and local rules concerning filing for modification of custody/visitation and notice requirements.
- Massachusetts Probate & Family Court r.proposition: - Massachusetts Probate & Family Court rules and local rules concerning filing for modification of custody/visitation and notice requirements.

- Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court a.raw_text: - Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court and Appeals Court decisions establishing the "material change in circumstances" standard for modification of custody and visitation.
- Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court a.proposition: - Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court and Appeals Court decisions establishing the "material change in circumstances" standard for modification of custody and visitation.

- Decisions addressing the weight to be.raw_text: - Decisions addressing the weight to be given to changes in parental housing and fitness, and how new circumstances (such as a parent obtaining adequate housing) can support a modification.
- Decisions addressing the weight to be.proposition: - Decisions addressing the weight to be given to changes in parental housing and fitness, and how new circumstances (such as a parent obtaining adequate housing) can support a modification.

- Decisions interpreting the \"best inte.raw_text: - Decisions interpreting the "best interests of the child" factors (including stability, school routine, child’s developmental stage, and continuity of care).
- Decisions interpreting the \"best inte.proposition: - Decisions interpreting the "best interests of the child" factors (including stability, school routine, child’s developmental stage, and continuity of care).

- Cases addressing phased or graduated i.raw_text: - Cases addressing phased or graduated increases in overnight visitation and appropriate safeguards and standards.
- Cases addressing phased or graduated i.proposition: - Cases addressing phased or graduated increases in overnight visitation and appropriate safeguards and standards.

- Cases addressing the relevance of agre.raw_text: - Cases addressing the relevance of agreement between parents, and the Court’s responsibility to independently determine what is in the child's best interests.
- Cases addressing the relevance of agre.proposition: - Cases addressing the relevance of agreement between parents, and the Court’s responsibility to independently determine what is in the child's best interests.

Probate and Family Court Rules.proposition: Petitioner requests that the Court schedule a hearing on this Complaint for Modification and that notice of the time and place of hearing be provided to Respondent in accordance with the Probate and Family Court Rules.

- Cases on logistics of exchanges, schoo.raw_text: - Cases on logistics of exchanges, school-night stability, and how frequent shuttling undermines the child’s welfare.
- Cases on logistics of exchanges, schoo.proposition: - Cases on logistics of exchanges, school-night stability, and how frequent shuttling undermines the child’s welfare.
